info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:18PM EDT until June 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN INDIANA...SOUTHERN JEFFERSON...EAST CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHEASTERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 518 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near New Bethlehem, or 12 miles southwest of Brookville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Punxsutawney, Brookville, Reynoldsville, New Bethlehem, Sykesville, Falls Creek, Big Run, Dayton, Summerville, Rossiter, Hawthorn, and Glen Campbell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
